channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023080555
item.description:
Report X-2023080555

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat discovered on the inbound. someone placed it in a lined tote and brought it to the damage area, where they placed it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap. all have stained labels. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023080144
item.description:
Report X-2023080144

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-09
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the unload lying on its side after opening a trailer. DescribePack: One of the caps on one of the bottles ended up coming loose resulting in some loss of product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in tote and chemical was watered down and absorbed to clean to spill.

item.title: Report X-2023080118
item.description:
Report X-2023080118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package was discovered this morning on the inbound and was removed from the van, then brought to the damage area. someone placed a code 39 on the package with a note, "pending inspection." HESS specialist began to work on the package and discovered that it was an undeclared hazmat, placing it in a lined tote and moving it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023070505
item.description:
Report X-2023070505

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP, BY THE RESPONDER. IN THE DMP, PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN, ONE GLASS JUG OF, XYLENES REAGENT (ACS), BEING SHIPPED AS A FLAMMABLE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE, (UN1307, XYLENES, 3, II 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 4 L). UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED GLASS JUG SHATTERD INSIDE ITS CARTON. ALL LIQUID WAS ABSORBED AND ALL PACKING MATER WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

item.title: Report X-2023070354
item.description:
Report X-2023070354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-08
  • City: South St Paul
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Citizen adjacent to yard reported faint ammonia odor coming from the yard. Fire department responded to area to begin investigation. Hazardous Material Emergency Response Manager and contractor support Rybak Environmental, llc. inspected yard and found the PROX 30244 releasing from the vapor valve being open and plug less than tool tight. Valve was closed by response team and plug tightened tool tight. Car was secured then released back to transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023070343
item.description:
Report X-2023070343

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE AUDITOR NOTICED A STRONG SMELL FROM THE PACKAGE AND TOLD THE RESPONDER. RESPONDER RESPONDED AND DISCOVERED THE CAP ON ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE. THE CONTAINERS WERE VENTED CAPS, AND CANNOT BE RETURNED IN A SALVAGE DRUM, ALL FOUR CONTAINERS DISPOSED OF VIA THE DMP BY RESPONDER.

item.title: Report X-2023070267
item.description:
Report X-2023070267

  • City: MAPLE GROVE

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE AUDITOR NOTICED THAT THE OUTER PACKAGE WAS STAINED AND EMITTING A STRONG ODOR. THE RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED, RETRIEVED THE PACKAGE AND REMOVED IT TO THE PROCESSING AREA. RESPONDER FOUND THAT ONE OF THE CAPS OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WAS COMPLETELY DISLODGED. CANNOT BE RETURNED IN A SALVAGE DRUM, ALL FOUR CONTAINERS WERE PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023070085
item.description:
Report X-2023070085

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP, BY THE RESPONDER. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED BY RESPONDER AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, 1 GALLON METAL PAINT CAN, FILLED WITH CHEMLOK 207 PRIMER FOR ADHESIVE, BEING SHIPPED AS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAX-MAT PACKAGE (UN1133, ADHESIVES, 3, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 1 GALLON). THE LID ON THE METAL CAN HAD COME LOOSE DURING SHIPMENT, ALLOWING THE PAINT TO ESCAPE AND STAIN THE OUTER CARTON PLUS INNER CAN, ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023070036
item.description:
Report X-2023070036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-24
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP BY THE RESPONDER. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN TWO, 1 GALLON, PLASTIC JUGS, OF ALPHA 90 IA FLUX, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE, (UN3624, CORROSIVE,LIQUID, ACIDIC, INGORANIC, N.O.S.; (HYDROCHLORIC ACID, ZINC CLORIDE); 8, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 2 GAL). UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED ONE OF THE PLASTIC BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP WHICH ALLOWED A SMALL AMOUNT OF THE ACID TO LEAK ONTO THE OUTER CARTON PLUS THE OTHER INNER BOTTLES. ALL PRODUCT WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023061344
item.description:
Report X-2023061344

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN FOUR, 1 GALLON, PLASTIC JUGS OF STATE FLOOR WIZARD, HIGH PERFORMANCE FLOOR STRIPPER, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT (UN3267, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, BASIC, ORGANIC, N.O.S, (ETHANOLAMINE), 8, PG II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 4 GAL). THE CAPS ON ONE OF THE FOUR JUGS HAD COME LOOSE, WHICH ALLOWED A SMALL AMOUNT OF THE CORROSIVE LIQUID TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE INNER PLASTIC JUGS, PLUS THE OUTER CARTON. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.
